result.execSummary:
The defendant Terrence Ullsperger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Stalking, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Total costs paid in full by previously posted bond.  Remaining bond to be returned to the posting party.

Defendant to participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the probation agent.

Defendant to submit a DNA sample. 

No contact with: Meekwon Golf Course, Stix Golf Entertainment, Child Advocacy Center Saukville, and victims: M.G.Z., M.J.Z., E.S., and R.B.

records.addlTxt: 10:57 AM Prosecuting attorney Benjamin Lindsay in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Terrence Ullsperger in court.  Attorney Jason Daniel Baltz in court for Terrence Ullsperger.  Counsel submits plea questionnaire.  Court examines Defendant as to submitted waiver.  Defendant enters guilty plea.  Court accepts the plea, finding it to be free and voluntary, and finds the Defendant guilty as to their plea.  State as to sentencing.  Counsel as to sentencing.  Statements by Defendant.  Court renders judgment.
